result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin C. SANTEFORD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin C. SANTEFORD

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

Count 2 - Disorderly conduct (DVO) - Guilty plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, substantial battery and count 3, criminal damage to property.  Motion granted.  Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for forty-five (45) days, under the Huber Law, to commence on 09-30-14 at 5:00 a.m.  Court costs are waived.  
Waiver of Right to Attorney. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 09-05-14 @ 8:30 am

Defendant would like to have an office appointment with ADA Griesbach before he enters a plea.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney to be set. 
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 08-26-14 at 2:00 p.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-27-14 at 10:00 a.m.  
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-03-14 at 10:00 a.m.  
Minutes.
Defendant requests counsel.  Initial appearance reset to 04-28-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of criminal damage to property, disorderly conduct and substantial battery.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no assaultive contact with Kristen Muench   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
